definition: with resentment; in a resentful manner
toward the posterior end of the body
in a dry laconic manner;  he said dryly
in an abundant and luxuriant manner
in, at, or toward the front
in the manner of something that has become a byword
in a very agitated manner; as if possessed by an evil spirit
in a manner that jars and irritates
in an unfair and insulting manner
with hostility; in a belligerent hostile manner
in a weak or pale or languid manner
in an absentminded or preoccupied manner
in a chaste and virtuous manner
in a series; one after another
in the manner of prosperous people
in an obvious and provable manner
in an unarguable and undisputed manner
with pessimism; in a pessimistic manner
without pity; in a merciless manner
in an uncontrolled and rampant manner
with intention; in an intentional manner
in a set manner without serious attention
in a shy or timid or bashful manner
in such a way as to pose a problem
in a bewildering and confusing manner
with reverence; in a reverent manner
in grief-stricken loneliness; without comforting circumstances or prospects
with one side forward or to the front
with considerable certainty; without much doubt
without speed (`slow' is sometimes used informally for `slowly')
vacuously or complacently and unconsciously foolish
with suavity; in a suave manner
